title: Dame Marie Bashir, First Female Governor Of NSW Remembered | 10 News
description: An extraordinary Australian, dedicated to her state, that's how Dame Marie Bashir is being remembered tonight. The first female Governor of New South Wales died yesterday, but leaves behind a legacy of service, compassion and dignity. Her advocacy for social issues and supporting some of our community's most vulnerable are just some of the many reasons she'll long be remembered. title: Man Faces Court Over Alleged Online Threats To Shoot PM Anthony Albanese | 10 News
description: A man has faced court accused of an online tirade during which he threatened to shoot the Prime Minister. Today he was granted bail but has been banned from social media, his defence saying the 45-year-old was just angry and venting. title: Trump’s One-Year Anniversary As President, Spain Train Crash & Beckham Family Drama | 10 News
description: US president Donald trump has marked the first anniversary of his return to the White House, but he faces protests at home, and fury abroad. Europe is pushing back on his threats to seize Greenland while American cities are increasingly reacting to his hardline on illegal immigrants.    Spain is reeling after another deadly train crash the latest killing at least one person and leaving more than 30 injured.   24 hours after his son launched a blistering attack against him and wife, Victoria, David Beckham has both dodged questions and given a clue to his thinking about the rift. title: Teenage Woman Survives Being Stabbed More Than 10 Times In Ambush Attack | 10 News
description: A teenage woman has miraculously survived being stabbed more than 10 times when she was attacked in the driveway of her family home at Kew. Her parents fought to stop her bleeding before police and paramedics arrived and helped save her life. title: Coalition Cohesion Shattered, Antisemitic Attack On Melbourne Teens, Emergency Shark Kits | 10 News+
description: A new twist in the divide over hate speech laws has seen three senior Nationals resign from the Federal Shadow Cabinet after defying the Cabinet's position on new reforms, bringing into question just how united the Coalition actually is.  Victoria Police are on the hunt for the occupants of a car who allegedly followed a group of Jewish boys and hurled antisemitic abuse at them in Melbourne.  Four shark attacks across NSW within a matter of days has sparked calls for implementation of emergency shark bite kits across Aussie beaches. title: Spree Of Shark Attacks Prompts Calls For Emergency Kits On All Aussie Beaches | 10 News+
description: Should emergency shark bite kits be installed at all Aussie beaches?  A local NSW surfer who designed ‘community shark bite kits’ after two of his mates were attacked says these potentially lifesaving kits should be rolled out along the coast.  The call comes after a recent spree of shark attacks in NSW. title: Coalition In Turmoil After Resignations, Trump Heads To Davos, Skin Cancer Vaccine | 10’s Late News
description: Tonight on 10’s Late News – the future of the coalition is in doubt after all Nationals MPs quit the shadow ministry, following a dispute over the hate speech laws.
